publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2220 Mr Keith Harding: Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Weekâ€”That the Parliament congratulates the Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group, which provides help, support and information for those with prostate problems and their families, for holding an awareness week in the Kingdom Shopping Centre, Glenrothes from 10 to 15 September 2001, in order to draw attention to the extent of the disease in the region and how it can be diagnosed and treated, preferably at an early stage to improve the chances of success.
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) Mary Scanlon*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) Tricia Marwick*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Murdo Fraser*

S1M-2220 Mr Keith Harding: Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week-That the Parliament congratulates the Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group, which provides help, support and information for those with prostate problems and their families, for holding an awareness week in the Kingdom Shopping Centre, Glenrothes from 10 to 15 September 2001, in order to draw attention to the extent of the disease in the region and how it can be diagnosed and treated, preferably at an early stage to improve the chances of success. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Mr Keith Raffan, Tricia Marwick, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Murdo Fraser
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) David Mundell*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) Alex Neil*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-2220 Mr Keith Harding: Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week-That the Parliament congratulates the Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group, which provides help, support and information for those with prostate problems and their families, for holding an awareness week in the Kingdom Shopping Centre, Glenrothes from 10 to 15 September 2001, in order to draw attention to the extent of the disease in the region and how it can be diagnosed and treated, preferably at an early stage to improve the chances of success. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Mr Keith Raffan, Tricia Marwick, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Murdo Fraser, David Mundell, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Scott Barrie
S1M-2220 Fife Prostate Cancer Support Group's Awareness Week (lodged on 14 September 2001) Mr Jamie McGrigor*
